msbt.message: I've gone rather gaga over painting, lately.
I'll paint anytime, anywhere, my dear. It's my true passion! Though, eh, I am quite new at it. Expressing my feelings through art is giving my life new meaningat least for today.

Painting a picture is like taking a journey into your very own soul.Each new image I make is but a mirror reflecting a new aspect of myself. Well, that sounded very profound! You might want to write that down, darling!

I'm working on my pièce de résistance now, in fact! It's quite daring. See, it's both a landscape painting AND a portrait. And I call the art style"abstract surrealist realism." Of course, I'm adding only one brush stroke each day, so it'll be some time before anyone sees it.
No matter what's going on in my life, I need only take a hot bath and all my worries melt away.
When that warmth seeps into your bones, the pent-up anxieties float away like so much steam. It's like your body and your soul get a good scrubbing at the same time. It's magical!
And I tell you, there's nothing better than a glass of after a bath. Put one hand on your hip, hold your drink like a movie star, and enjoy the luxury of the moment.
And if I can slip into a jetted hot tub instead Well, THAT is heaven on earth, my dear. Soaking among those pippy-popping bubblesI feel transported to an entirely different place.
Darling, I've absolutely fallen in LOVE with making pottery.

Kneading and rolling the clay is SO relaxing, and it clears my mind like nothing else. Of course, a bowl is a big task when you're just starting out, so I'm doing some free-form sculptures instead.What? I am NOT just playing about!<10_4 /> My clay worms and snakes are sophisticated pieces of FINE ART!
When you sit and face the clay for long enough, it becomes a conversation between you and it.You must convince the clay to become what you want it to be. Why, I sound just like a real sculptor!

Right now I'm working on a vase that'll really bring out the best in any flowers you put into it. But I just can't seem to get it exactly the way I want it, yetI'm so focused on creating a fancy shape, I keep forgetting to make an opening for the flowers.
Whatever you do, darling, don't underestimate the importance of a polite greeting.

When someone greets you with a polite smile and a warm hello, it makes you feel appreciated, yes? That kind of thing can change someone's entire day.I, for one, have made it my goal to give EVERYONE a cheerful and uplifting greeting. SoHELLO!
"Good morning!"<10_4 /> "Good afternoon!"<10_4 /> "Good evening!"Speaking positively and confidently to a friend can strengthen your relationship.It's almost as if proper greetings are magic words

Every day may bring something new, but common greetings stay pretty much the same, don't they? That must be because they're such important words, right?When you're feeling a little blue, a cheery hello from a friend can have a truly magical effect on you.
I've been doing some volunteering in my free time lately.

I just LOVE , you see.I started doing little things here and there out of the kindness of my heartlike watering the flowers. Doing nice things for others feels SO good, my dear! I don't know why I didn't think of it sooner.

Of course, it's not the kind of thing I go around bragging about or anything.But I do sneak around pulling weeds and doing other little things here and there to beautify . I'm sure the day will come when my good work brings big smiles to many faces.

Nothing too grand, mind you. I just do little things like returning lost items to their owners. You should try it sometime. If you find something somebody dropped, just take it to its owner! You'll find that even the smallest kindness can make someone tremendously happy.

Oh! I almost forgot, ! A magazine has published a fashion photo of me! Yes, little ol' me! I wonder what the others will say if they see it? Oooh, do you think they'll be jealous? Oh! You want to know where you can see it? Whyit's on the last page of my hometown's free magazine.

So, apparently my friends are saying I moved to the island because I needed to escape modern life. According to the rumor mill, I wanted to get away from it all so I could balance my chakras or some such. I mean, island life has been quite restorativebut must they talk about my chakras behind my back?
Why, , you simply must let me tell you about this new reality show I've been watching!

There are three contestants. They've been dropped off on an island and must do their best to survive. But all they have with them is , , and ! I tell you, I can NOT stop watching it! Still, why anyone would sign up to be on this show is beyond me.

It delves deep into the wild and crazy life of a beloved-yet-controversial star. Of course, I don't normally go in for stories about . But, I confess, I find the show enthralling. It nearly inspired me to try the sport myself! Alas, I'm allergic to sweating. I suppose it just wasn't meant to be.

It follows a young chef trying to break into culinary stardom with her rather unconventional dishes. On the last episode, she whipped up , if you can believe it! My stars, it looked awful. But in the end, the judges loved it, ! And lately I've been having these terrible cravings for too!
When my creative juices are running dry—it's rare, but it happens—I like to teach myself a new skill.

Lately, I've been powerfully drawn to sculpting tutorials. My first project was a clay .It made for a darling centerpiece But every time I would entertain, my guests tried to nibble on it.Eventually, I decided the constant disclaimers weren't worth the hassle. Talent is such a curse, !

At the moment, I'm pursuing my dream of woodworking. My last piece was a very chic figurine.I'd show it to you, but I was working from a mirror, and I daresay I captured my own likeness to a T.So I burned it to cinders. There's only room for one in this world, .

I'm currently breezing through a crystal decoration course. You should see what I did to my .It was too beautiful for this world, in a way. The stones I used were so large that they threw it out of true.I thought I'd mastered the balance between form and function, but it seems I have lessons to learn yet.
